pr_title: AArch64: Add a flag for implicit NULLCHKs to memory reference class

timeline.message:
AArch64: Add a flag for implicit NULLCHKs to memory reference class

Add a flag for implicit NULLCHKs to `J9::ARM64::MemoryReference`.
Add a method for analyzing current node and setting the flag to `J9::ARM64::MemoryReference`.

Signed-off-by: Akira Saitoh <saiaki@jp.ibm.com>

AArch64: Add a flag for implicit NULLCHKs to memory reference class

Add a flag for implicit NULLCHKs to `J9::ARM64::MemoryReference`.
Add a method for analyzing current node and setting the flag to `J9::ARM64::MemoryReference`.

Signed-off-by: Akira Saitoh <saiaki@jp.ibm.com>

timeline.author: knn-k

replies.bodyText: I think the default constructor of flags8_t will run, but added _j9Flags to the member initialization list in J9MemoryReference's constructors.
replies.author: Akira1Saitoh

replies.bodyText:
Ah, I didn't notice flags_t was a class in OMR.
Thank you for the change anyway.
replies.author: knn-k
